description: Number of permutations of n elements with distinct cycle lengths.
references: D. H. Greene and D. E. Knuth, Mathematics for the Analysis of Algorithms, 2nd ed., Birkhaeuser, Boston, 1982.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
Philippe Flajolet, Éric Fusy, Xavier Gourdon, Daniel Panario and Nicolas Pouyanne, A Hybrid of Darboux's Method and Singularity Analysis in Combinatorial Asymptotics, arXiv:math.CO/0606370
A. Knopfmacher and R. Warlimont, Counting permutations and polynomials with a restricted factorization pattern, Australasian J. of Combinatorics, 13 (1996), 151-162.
D. H. Lehmer, On reciprocally weighted partitions, Acta Arithmetica XXI (1972), 379-388.
A. M. Odlyzko, Asymptotic enumeration methods, pp. 1063-1229 of R. L. Graham et al., eds., Handbook of Combinatorics, 1995; see Examples 8.10 and 11.8 (pdf, ps)
formula: E.g.f.: prod {m >= 1} (1+x^m/m).a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} (n-1)!/(n-k)!*b(k)*a(n-k), where b(k) = Sum_{d divides k} (-d)^(1-k/d) and a(0) = 1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Oct 13 2002Asymptotics: a(n) ~ n!(e^{-g} + e^{-g}/n + O((log n)/n^2)), where g is the Euler gamma.
maple: p := product((1+x^m/m), m=1..100): s := series(p,x,100): for i from 1 to 100 do printf(`%.0f,`,i!*coeff(s,x,i)) od:
mathematica: max = 20; p = Product[(1 + x^m/m), {m, 1, max}]; s = Series[p, {x, 0, max}]; CoefficientList[s, x]*Range[0, max]! (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 05 2011, after Maple *)
prog: (PARI) {a(n)=if(n<0, 0, n!*polcoeff( prod(k=1, n, 1+x^k/k, 1+x*O(x^n)), n))} /* _Michael Somos_, Sep 19 2006 */
author: Arnold Knopfmacher (ARNOLDK(AT)gauss.cam.wits.ac.za)
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Dec 24 1999
